info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 2 at 3:07PM CDT until April 2 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Texas. In southwest Missouri, Webster and Wright.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT Wednesday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 307 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Piney River at Union Road, Wolf Creek at Highway AB, West Fork Roubidoux Creek at Upton Road, Boone Creek at Boone Creek Road, Big Piney River at Cleveland Road, Whetstone Creek at Owens Road and Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mountain Grove, Houston, Licking, Mansfield, Norwood, Hartville, Dawson, Huggins, Bendavis, Graff, Success, Bucyrus, Roby, Hazelton and Prescott. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Texas, MO; Webster, MO; Wright, MO
